SEARCH
Package Models

Class PatientManager

java.lang.Object
Models.PatientManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
PatientInterface
public class PatientManager extends Object implements PatientInterface
Manages the patient profiles in the system. This class handles CRUD operations on the patient database, such as retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting patient profiles. It also manages the loading and saving of patient data to a CSV file.
Since:
2024-11-21
Version:
1.0

    Constructs a new PatientManager instance and initializes the patient list.

  • Constructor Details

    • PatientManager

      public PatientManager()
      Constructs a new PatientManager instance and initializes the patient list.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PatientManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the PatientManager. If the instance does not exist, it creates a new one.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of PatientManager

    • getAllPatients

      public static List<Patient> getAllPatients()
      Retrieves all patients from the database and initializes the patient list. This method fetches data from the CSV file and returns the list of patients.
      Returns:
      a list of all patients

    • getPatient

      public static Patient getPatient(String hospitalID)
      Retrieves a patient profile based on the hospital ID. Access is restricted if the logged-in user is a patient and attempts to view another patient's profile.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the ID of the patient to retrieve
      Returns:
      the patient object if found, or null if no match is found or access is denied

    • createPatient

      public static int createPatient(String hospitalID, String password, String role, String name, LocalDate birthDate, String gender, String phoneNum, String email, String bloodType)
      Creates a new patient profile and stores it in the system. If a patient with the same ID already exists, it prevents creating a new profile. The patient data is saved to the patient list and written to the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the ID of the new patient
      password - the password for the new patient
      role - the role of the new patient
      name - the name of the new patient
      birthDate - the birth date of the new patient
      gender - the gender of the new patient
      phoneNum - the phone number of the new patient
      email - the email of the new patient
      bloodType - the blood type of the new patient
      Returns:
      1 if the patient was created successfully, 0 if the patient already exists

    • readPatient

      public static void readPatient(String hospitalID)
      Reads a patient profile and displays their details. Access is restricted if the logged-in user is a patient and attempts to view another patient's profile.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - the ID of the patient to read

    • initializeObjects

      public static List<Patient> initializeObjects()
      Initializes the patient list by reading data from the CSV file. This method populates the patient list with Patient objects created from the CSV file content.
      Returns:
      a list of Patient objects initialized from the CSV file

    • updatePatient

      public static int updatePatient(Patient updatedPatient)
      Updates the details of an existing patient in the database. The updated patient data is written back to the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      updatedPatient - the patient object with updated details
      Returns:
      1 if the patient was successfully updated, 0 if the patient was not found

    • deletePatient

      public static int deletePatient(String hospitalID)
      Deletes a patient profile from the patient list and the corresponding CSV file.

      The method searches for a patient with the given hospital ID. If the patient is found, the profile is removed from the internal list of patients, and the updated list is saved back to the CSV file. If the patient is not found, a message is displayed indicating that no matching profile was found.

      Parameters:
      hospitalID - The hospital ID of the patient to be deleted.
      Returns:
      1 if the patient profile was successfully deleted and the CSV file was updated, 0 if no matching patient profile was found.
